title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 559.2 - Reporting requirements: logs
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 559.2 - Reporting requirements: logs

State Regulations

Before completion, the operator of a "Bass Island" well
must run, in open hole, a gamma ray log, a neutron or resistivity log, and a
density log on the well. The operator may run any or all of the logs, other
than the resistivity log, in a cased hole if running of the log in open hole
may pose a safety hazard. The operator must file three copies of each of those
logs with the department within 30 calendar days of their being run. The
operator also must file with the department, within 30 calendar days of its
being specifically requested by the department, a copy of any other log that
was run on that well. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
559.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
